tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE performance_metrics (
    metric_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    metric_name VARCHAR(255),
    time_period_start TIMESTAMP,
    time_period_end TIMESTAMP,
    value DECIMAL(10, 2)
)

CREATE TABLE benchmark_results ( 
    result_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    metric_id INT, 
    period_id INT, 
    result_value DECIMAL(10,2), 
    FOREIGN KEY (metric_id) REFERENCES performance_metrics(metric_id), 
    FOREIGN KEY (period_id) REFERENCES time_periods(period_id) 
);

CREATE TABLE benchmarking_results (
    result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    metric_id INT,
    time_period_id INT,
    execution_time DECIMAL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_metric FOREIGN KEY (metric_id) REFERENCES performance_metrics(id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_time_period FOREIGN KEY (time_period_id) REFERENCES time_periods(time_period_id)
);

CREATE TABLE comparisons (
    comparison_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    metric_id_1 INT,
    metric_id_2 INT,
    time_period_id INT,
    comparison_result VARCHAR(255),
    CONSTRAINT fk_metric_1 FOREIGN KEY (metric_id_1) REFERENCES performance_metrics(id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_metric_2 FOREIGN KEY (metric_id_2) REFERENCES performance_metrics(id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_time_period_comp FOREIGN KEY (time_period_id) REFERENCES time_periods(time_period_id)
);

CREATE TABLE benchmark_results (
    result_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    benchmark_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    benchmark_score FLOAT NOT NULL,
    time_period_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (time_period_id) REFERENCES time_periods(time_period_id)
);

CREATE TABLE comparison_metrics (
    comparison_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    metric_id INT NOT NULL,
    result_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (metric_id) REFERENCES performance_metrics(metric_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (result_id) REFERENCES benchmark_results(result_id)
);
